intro: Parinari heteropetala, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by edible, orange-red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests and secondary growth areas.
